title: Ukrainian air defence downs 19 out of 21 Russian attack drones overnight
message:
Air defence operating.
Photo: General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on FacebookRussian forces attacked Ukraine with 21 Shahed-131/136 attack UAVs on the night of 18-19 June, and Ukrainian air defence managed to destroy 19 drones.
Source: Ukraine’s Air Force on TelegramQuote from the Air Force: "As a result of combat efforts, 19 enemy Shahed attack UAVs were shot down in Kherson, Mykolaiv, Dnipropetrovsk, Kirovohrad, Khmelnytskyi and Lviv oblasts."
The air attack was repelled by fighter aircraft, anti-aircraft missile units and electronic warfare units of Ukraine’s Air Force, as well as mobile fire groups of the Ukrainian defence forces.
Ukrainian air defence was responding in Lviv Oblast.
event_breakdown: Russian forces fired 21 attack UAVs at Ukraine on the night of 18-19 June. 19 UAVs were shot down near Lviv, Kherson, Mykolaiv, Dnipropetrovsk, Kirovohrad, Khmelnytskyi, and Khmelnytsky.

title: Bomb goes off in Lamitan hours after mayor declares city Abu Sayyaf - free
message:
The explosion occurred just hours after Lamitan was declared an Abu Sayyaf-free city by its mayor.
Lieutenant Colonel Arlan Delumpines, Lamitan City police chief, said the bomb, which was improvised, went off around 6:47 pm at a gasoline station in Barangay Matibay.
The explosion occurred hours after Lamitan Mayor Roderick Furigay declared the city free from the dreaded Abu Sayyaf during his State of the City Report (SOCR) on Tuesday morning.
The declaration of Lamitan City as ASG-free was the highlight of the celebration of the 17th year of cityhood of Lamitan that day.

title: Ship Attacked by Yemen Houthi Rebels in Fatal Assault Sinks in Red Sea in Second - such Sinking
message:
The sinking of the Tutor in the Red Sea marks what appears to be a new escalation by the Iranian-backed Houthis in their campaign targeting shipping through the vital maritime corridor over the Israel-Hamas war in the Gaza Strip.
The Liberian-flagged, Greek-owned-and-operated Tutor sank in the Red Sea, the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said in a warning to sailors in the region.
“The vessel is believed to have sunk.”The Houthis did not immediately acknowledge the sinking.
The Tutor came under attack a week ago by a bomb-carrying Houthi drone boat in the Red Sea.
In March, the Belize-flagged Rubymar carried a load of fertilizer sank in the Red Sea after taking on water for days following a rebel attack.

title: Authorities Investigate Fatal Stabbing in Lennox
message:
A man was fatally stabbed Tuesday in Lennox.
Investigators were sent to the intersection of 111th Street and Larch Avenue around 12:25 p.m. Tuesday regarding a fatal stabbing, according to the Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department.
It was unclear what may have motivated the attack, and there was no description of a suspect.
Anyone with information regarding the fatal attack was urged to contact the Sheriff’s Homicide Bureau at 323-890-5500.
Tipsters who prefer to remain anonymous can call Crime Stoppers at 800-222-8477 or visit lacrimestoppers.org.

title: Club Q Shooter Sentenced For Federal Hate Crime And Gun Charges
message:
Anderson Lee Aldrich, the individual responsible for the 2022 mass shooting at Club Q, an LGBTQ2S+ nightclub in Colorado Springs, was sentenced to life in prison without parole plus 190 years on Tuesday (June 18).
Aldrich, 24, pleaded guilty to 74 federal hate crime and gun charges related to the attack that left five dead and 19 injured.
The sentencing follows Aldrich's guilty plea to state charges last year, which resulted in five consecutive life terms and an additional 2,212 years without parole.
The shooting occurred as patrons were gathering for Transgender Day of Remembrance events, including a drag show.
The shooting has been described as a "brazen and calculated" attack on the club's employees and patrons and a "bias-motivated, premeditated, mass-casualty attack."

Event: 2022 Colorado Springs Shooting at Club Q
Target Event: Mass Shooting
Date: June 18, 2023

title: Club Q Shooter Sentenced For Federal Hate Crime And Gun Charges
message:
Anderson Lee Aldrich, the individual responsible for the 2022 mass shooting at Club Q, an LGBTQ2S+ nightclub in Colorado Springs, was sentenced to life in prison without parole plus 190 years on Tuesday (June 18).
Aldrich, 24, pleaded guilty to 74 federal hate crime and gun charges related to the attack that left five dead and 19 injured.
The sentencing follows Aldrich's guilty plea to state charges last year, which resulted in five consecutive life terms and an additional 2,212 years without parole.
The shooting occurred as patrons were gathering for Transgender Day of Remembrance events, including a drag show.
The shooting has been described as a "brazen and calculated" attack on the club's employees and patrons and a "bias-motivated, premeditated, mass-casualty attack."
event_breakdown: Club Q Shooting, Colorado Springs

title: Three Factors Indicate Potential Terrorist Threat to Paris Olympics
message:
Governments are increasingly concerned about the specific threat the terrorist group poses to the upcoming Paris Olympics and Paralympic Games.
But there's still the question of whether Islamic State would want to devote the necessary resources to carrying it out.
Some recent Islamic State statements have hearkened back to the group's 2015 Paris massacre that killed 130 people.
Moreover, Islamic State is not in the same position as it was in 2014 and 2015.
Islamic State might decide on a similar strategy around the Paris Olympics, given that provocation and attrition of resources are both common terrorist strategies.

title: Colorado Springs LGBTQ+ club shooter Anderson Lee Aldrich sentenced to multiple life sentences
message:
A man who killed five people in a shooting at an LGBTQ+ club has been sentenced to 55 life terms in prison.
Anderson Lee Aldrich entered Club Q - a sanctuary for LGBTQ+ people in the conservative city of Colorado Springs - with a semi-automatic rifle and a handgun during a drag show in November 2022.
"The admission that these were hate crimes is important to the government, and it's important to the community of Club Q," said prosecutor Alison Connaughty.
Image: Floral tributes were placed outside Club Q in the days after the shooting.
A hand-drawn map of Club Q was also found at his apartment, along with a black binder of training material entitled 'How to handle an active shooter'.

message:
Tuesday, June 18, 2024 - A 15-year-old girl from Mississippi is being held in an adult detention facility for attempting to murder her mother.
Lexi Jade Brown attacked her mother while she was asleep in what appears to be a crime influenced by occult beliefs.
Officers responded to a call about a stabbing at 2:33 a.m. and found the victim, Brown's mother, with multiple stab wounds.
According to the police, the mother reported she was asleep when she was attacked by her daughter.
After fending off the assault, the mother said her daughter attempted to set the house on fire.

title: Israel may have violated laws of war in Gaza campaign , UN rights office says
message:
Israel may have violated laws of war in Gaza campaign, UN rights office saysBy Gabrielle Tétrault-FarberGENEVA (Reuters) -Israeli forces may have repeatedly violated fundamental principles of the laws of war and failed to distinguish between civilians and fighters in their Gaza Strip military campaign, the United Nations human rights office said on Wednesday.
In a report assessing six Israeli attacks that caused a high number of casualties and destruction of civilian infrastructure, the U.N. human rights office (OHCHR) said Israeli forces "may have systematically violated the principles of distinction, proportionality, and precautions in attack."
"We call first on the Israeli authorities to take steps to ensure that proper investigations, transparent investigations are held."
She added that, in the absence of transparent investigations, there would be "a need for international action in this regard as well."
Last week the U.N. human rights office said the killing of civilians during an Israeli operation to free four hostages could amount to war crimes, but so might Palestinian militants' holding of captives in densely populated areas.
event_breakdown:
Location: Gaza Strip
Event: New report from UN says Israel may have violated laws of war during it's military campaign with it's attacks, and attacks may have caused heavy casualties and destruction of civilian infrastructure
The UN's human rights office found Israeli forces  "may have systematically violated the principles of distinction, proportionality, and precautions in attack."
"We call first on the Israeli authorities to take steps to ensure that proper investigations, transparent investigations are held,"
OHCHR spokesperson Ravina Shamdasani said. "In the absence of transparent investigations, there would be a need for international action in this regard as well."

title: Nebraska man charged in violent carjacking spree in Bloomington , Shakopee
message:
A Nebraska man faces multiple charges, including attempted murder and carjacking, following a violent incident in Bloomington, Minn. on Sunday.
Nathan Mathias Sughroue, 31, is accused of carjacking two vehicles and stabbing a man at a gas station on June 16, according to the Hennepin County Attorney's Office.
Authorities responded to a call about an attack at a gas station on West 98th Street at 1:02 p.m.
They found the victim, whose clothes were soaked in blood, being helped by another man.
The crime spree began about 90 minutes earlier that day in Shakopee, where Sughroue allegedly carjacked a woman at knifepoint.

title: EU - funded Egyptian forces  rounding up and deporting Sudanese refugee | Global development
message:
The Egyptian authorities have used EU-funded security forces in a campaign of mass arrests and forcible deportations against refugees from the Sudan war, according to a human rights group report.
People were held in makeshift detention facilities run by Egyptian border guards, a force that has received extensive EU funding.
Fighting between the Sudanese Armed Forces and the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) militia has since engulfed entire provinces.
View image in fullscreen Sudanese refugees waiting to be let into Egypt at the Argeen border crossing last year.
The EU would provide an additional €20m for Egypt, he said, to help “address this new wave of Sudanese refugees on your southern border”.

title: Israel may have violated laws of war in Gaza campaign , UN rights office says
message:
Israeli forces may have repeatedly violated fundamental principles of the laws of war and failed to distinguish between civilians and fighters in their Gaza Strip military campaign, the United Nations human rights office said on June 19.
In a report assessing six Israeli attacks that caused a high number of casualties and destruction of civilian infrastructure, the U.N. human rights office said Israeli forces “may have systematically violated the principles of distinction, proportionality, and precautions in attack.”"The requirement to select means and methods of warfare that avoid or at the very least minimise to every extent civilian harm appears to have been consistently violated in Israel's bombing campaign," said U.N. High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Turk.
Israel’s Gaza onslaughtIsrael's air and ground offensive has killed more than 37,400 people in the Hamas-ruled Palestinian territory, according to health authorities there.

message:
Wolfgang Schwan/Anadolu via Getty ImagesNorth Korea and South Korea have sent weapons to opposing sides of the war in Ukraine.
North Korea and South Korea have been fueling opposite sides of the war in Ukraine, positioning themselves as players in this conflict.

STR via Getty ImagesBoth North Korea and South Korea also have ideological reasons to be involved in the war in Ukraine.
event_breakdown:
North Korea and South Korea are fueling opposing sides of the war in Ukraine, positioning themselves as players in this conflict. North Korea appears to back Russia, while Seoul has sent ammunition to the Ukrainians. This escalation is brewing as both countries emerge from pandemic lockdowns. This story echoes the standoff between the two Koreas as recently as the 1990s.
The current situation in Ukraine is unique and challenging. The complexity and unpredictability of the situation make it difficult for many countries in the world to define their position on this issue. On the one hand, Russia, who continues to wage war, has the support of several countries in the region that consider Ukraine to be part of the Soviet Union. On the other hand, the majority of countries in the world consider Russia an aggressor. Against the backdrop of the situation with North Korea, the Republic of Korea, which has so far maintained a neutral position and called for an end to the war, is now sending ammunition to the Ukrainian side, and the United States is providing its assistance.
The current situation is a serious challenge for the Republic of Korea. On the one hand, the South Korean government’s sympathies for Ukraine, where many people from the Republic of Korea have close relatives, are obvious. But the attitude towards the United States, the enemy of the North, which calls for unconditional support of Washington, is pro-American. Under such pressure, South Korea must carefully navigate and resolve this situation, taking into account the potential consequences for itself.

title: Club Q Shooter Sentenced For Federal Hate Crime And Gun Charges
message:
Anderson Lee Aldrich, the individual responsible for the 2022 mass shooting at Club Q, an LGBTQ2S+ nightclub in Colorado Springs, was sentenced to life in prison without parole plus 190 years on Tuesday (June 18).
Aldrich, 24, pleaded guilty to 74 federal hate crime and gun charges related to the attack that left five dead and 19 injured.
The sentencing follows Aldrich's guilty plea to state charges last year, which resulted in five consecutive life terms and an additional 2,212 years without parole.
The shooting occurred as patrons were gathering for Transgender Day of Remembrance events, including a drag show.
The shooting has been described as a "brazen and calculated" attack on the club's employees and patrons and a "bias-motivated, premeditated, mass-casualty attack."

The sentencing follows Aldrich's guilty plea to state charges last year, which resulted in five consecutive life terms and an additional 2,212 years without parole.
The shooting occurred as patrons were gathering for Transgender Day of Remembrance events, including a drag show.
The shooting has been described as a "brazen and calculated" attack on the club's employees and patrons and a "bias-motivated, premeditated, mass-casualty attack."

Israel views Hezbollah as its most direct threat, and the two fought a 34-day war in 2006 that ended in a stalemate.

title: Chinese military rifle - toting robot dogs raise concerns in Congress
message:
Congress is worried that robot dogs with machine guns will be bounding onto the battlefield in the near future.
The issue has gained public attention in recent weeks after Chinese military officials showed off armed robotic quadrupeds during recent military drills with Cambodia.
In a video released by state-run CCTV on May 25, a 110-pound dog-like robot is shown carrying and firing an automatic rifle.
Leo covers Congress, Veterans Affairs and the White House for Military Times.

title: How Did North Korean Soldiers Wander Across the World Most Heavily Guarded Border ?
message:
So how, on the eve of Russian President Vladimir Putin’s summit Wednesday with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, did as many as 30 North Korean soldiers wander over the line separating North from South, causing South Korea to fire warning shots before the North Koreans withdrew?
On Tuesday, South Korean troops broadcast warnings and fired warning shots to turn back North Korean soldiers — somewhere between 20 to 30 — who briefly crossed the demarcation line in the DMZ.
When North Korean soldiers briefly crossed a different part of the line on June 11, the same scenario played out: Warning shots from the South; a North Korean withdrawal.
The North’s accidental intrusions this month may have been caused by a sudden jump in North Korean troops fortifying their side of the border.
Two American Army officers were axed to death in 1976 by North Korean soldiers, for instance.

title: Gaza conflict has caused major environmental damage , UN says
message:
Each square metre of the Gaza Strip is now littered with more than 107 kilogrammes (236 lbs) of debris.
The UN assessment adds to concerns about the unfolding humanitarian crisis and the environmental costs of war, with Ukraine also recording widespread ecological damage over the past two years.
"Understanding the environmental impacts of war is a grand challenge of our time," said Eoghan Darbyshire, a senior researcher at the UK-based nonprofit Conflict and Environment Observatory.
Over 92 per cent of water in the Gaza Strip was then deemed unfit for human consumption.
The Gaza Strip had one of the highest densities of rooftop solar panels in the world, with the US-based Centre for Strategic and International Studies estimating in 2023 some 12,400 rooftop solar systems.

message:

Hezbollah has fired thousands of projectiles at Israeli territory already while Israel has killed several Hezbollah fighters and launched a barrage of strikes against targets in Lebanon.

The Lebanese movement got involved in the war on Hamas's side by launching projectiles into northern Israel, but experts say it does not want a broader conflict.

title: Are Israel and Lebanon Hezbollah on the brink of war ?
message:
June 19, 2024 — Jerusalem (AFP)An escalating cross-border tit-for-tat between Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah raised fears Wednesday of a full-blown war, but experts are divided on the prospect of a wider conflict.
-The last war between Israel and Hezbollah broke out in July 2006, causing nearly 1,400 deaths over 34 days, including 1,200 on the Lebanese side, most of them civilians.
Hezbollah has fired thousands of projectiles at Israeli territory already while Israel has killed several Hezbollah fighters and launched a barrage of strikes against targets in Lebanon.
-Hezbollah says it is fighting on behalf of its ally Hamas in Gaza, where Israel has fought an eight-month war after the Palestinian militants' unprecedented October 7 attack on Israel.
The Lebanese movement got involved in the war on Hamas's side by launching projectiles into northern Israel, but experts say it does not want a broader conflict.
event_breakdown:
- On Wednesday, Hezbollah fired an antitank missile at an Israeli army vehicle along the Lebanese border, killing one soldier.
- Israel responded with a barrage of artillery fire at targets in southern Lebanon.
